title: The Study of the ideas of life, love, and death as seen through some of Edgar Allan Poe's poems
abstract: This thesis analyzes the ideas of life, love, and death as seen through Edgar Allan Poe's poems.The analysis deals with eleven poems.Ten of those poems present Poe's ideas about life, love, and death, and one poem is used to clarify the reason why Poe and the speakers in his poems have tendency to live in dreams. All of the ideas revealed through this thesis reflects Poe's own ideas.The study of the idea of life reveals his idea that real life is disappointing. His idea that human nature is to love is revealed through the study of the idea of love in many of h i s poems.The study of the idea of death covers the topic about his idea that death is not something frightening because it is a natural thing.
contributors: DANIEL LABERGE, BA OF ARTS (Examination Committee 1)
subjects: AMERICAN POETRY-18TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; POE, EDGAR ALLAN,1809-1849. IN POETRY-STUDY AND TEACHING
